Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.9596699] Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli NCTC 8007 (MIC=500 μM), Escherichia coli NCTC 10418 (MIC=500μM);Gram-positive bacterium:Staphylococcus aureus (MIC=500 μM);Clinical isolates:Acinetobacter sp.(MIC=2 μM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Has antimicrobial activity, which depends on the extracellular cation concentration. Antimicrobial properties include bacteriostasis, which is related to its ability to sequester free iron and thus inhibit microbial growth, as well as direct bactericidal properties leading to the release of lipopolysaccharides from the bacterial outer membrane. Can also prevent bacterial biofilm development in P.aeruginosa infection. Has weak antifungal activity against C.albicans. HLP 1 corresponded to the loop region of human lactoferricin (residues 20 to 35).

Literature.Title: Structure-function relationship of antibacterial synthetic peptides homologous to a helical surface region on human lactoferrin against Escherichia coli serotype O111.
Literature.Author: Chapple DS, Mason DJ, Joannou CL, Odell EW, Gant V, Evans RW.
